revised_title: A Study of the Eutectoid Transition Point in Carbon Steels
tldr: This study investigates the thermomagnetic properties of various carbon steels, focusing on the eutectoid transition point where the material changes from a homogeneous to a heterogeneous mixture of iron and carbide. The research reveals that the sudden loss of magnetism occurs at the same temperature for all steels, suggesting that the eutectoid patches have a consistent composition and that this temperature is the true transition point.
